title: The Cardigans - Long Gone Before Daylight [2003][FLAC]
description:
Long Gone Before Daylight marks a shift in theme for the Cardigans. Their last album, 1998&#039;s Gran Turismo, was a masterpiece. With Peter Svensson&#039;s quirky, driving, ultra-modern pop backing Nina Persson&#039;s icy dissections of doomed relationships, it was a Love Album informed more by Bret Easton Ellis than any high romance. So catchy, so cool, and so incredibly bleak--exceptional, intelligent pop in the tradition of Soft Cell and ABC. Long Gone Before Daylight, then, comes as something of a shock when the opening "Communication" and "You&#039;re the Storm"--both lush and beautiful pop--find Persson struggling for love then, come the Doors-like "And Then You Kissed Me," actually finding it. Real love, too--not the fascinatingly twisted variety of before. It&#039;s a terrible shame, for love reduces the Cardigans to the level of other musicians. But then, unpredictable devils, they hit you with "Couldn&#039;t Care Less," as Persson loses it all again, in the following "Please Sister" begging for advice, succor, anything. And now you realize; it&#039;s a pop-rock opera, the tale of one heart&#039;s tortuous and tortured journey through the mill. And it&#039;s superb. Persson, the finest pop lyricist working today, is on peak form while the band&#039;s back-to-roots grand piano and grander acoustic guitars provide an appropriately magnificent backing.
